Description: Body fragment of North Ionian black-figured pottery open vessel, perhaps a bowl. Interior glazed with two add red bands lined in white; exterior: two friezes separated by band with added red band lined in white; above, lion or panther with raised paw, and folded wing, rear and part leg of bird, both to right; blob rosette fill; perhaps horn of goat.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by British School at Athens. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For a similar lion see Fairbanks 1928, pl. 34 no 320.8 and CVA Philadelphia 2 (29), pl. 4. No. 5 (E179.B1), from Naukratis, is very like ours, although decorating the handle-plate of a column-krater. See also CVA Oxford 2 (9) IId, pl. 4 no.45 (G119.40), attributed to Camiran B from Naukratis and Venit 1988 no. 31 (Alexandria 9339) and pl. 8 an amphora or oinochoe ragment which is quite similar. For the lion as Wild Goat Style subject see British School at Athens Sherd 6 (Smith 2009, p.348, no.5, fig. 5) and for the panther see Kerschner and Schlotzhauer. T.J. Smith, "East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens", BSA 104, 2009, 349, fig. 7
Bibliographic references: Smith 2009 / East Greek Pottery in the Collection of the British School at Athens (p. 349, no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.641)
